result.execSummary:
The defendant Frank Martinez was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Aggravated Battery [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(6).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
Pay restitution of $65.32 joint/several with co-defendants (cost of obtaining medical records).
Pay additional restitution joint/several with co-defendants.  State to have additional 60 days to submit figures and then provide copy to the defendant and his attorney.

**11/03/14 Per restitution order - Restitution of $18,983.20 plus 10% surcharge of $1,898.32 for a total of $20.881.52.**
Pay court costs which includes the DNA surcharge.
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places: Daniel Sanchez, Steven Solis, their families or their residences, Iverson Park and the Co-defendants.

Provide a DNA sample unless already provided. 
Cooperate with any other assessments requested by the department. 
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.

Prosecuting Assistant District Attorney (ADA) Kristian Mukoski appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Agent Jessica Pech, Probation and Parole, appears at Counsel's table. Defendant Frank Martinez in court. 
03:16 PM The Court calls the case and appearances are stated. 

The matter before the Court on Probation and Paroles request for review due to Restitution and Court Obligations still owed.

The Court reviews the files and the balance that remains on the file.

Atty Mukoski advises the State does not have a position on the matter.

Agent Pech makes statements to the Court in regards to prior payments made by wage assignment, however states there is no wage assignment now.

The Court questions Mr. Martinez as to the lack of payments.

Mr. Martinez makes statements to the Court in regards to employment.

Agent Pech makes statements in regards to the last payments made by Mr. Martinez.

The Court is concerned with the lack of good faith effort made in payments in the last five months.

BY THE COURT:
Supervision is extended an additional year.
All other conditions of supervision remain the same.

Agent Pech provides Mr. Martinez a sheet of what is still outstanding.

The matter is concluded.
Letter from DOC dated 07/03/19 in re:  request by agent to have a review hearing with regards to the restitution and court ordered financial obligations owed by the defendant
Hearing on August 6, 2019 at 03:00 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Frank Martinez in court with attorney Adam Raabe. Defendant Frank Martinez in CUSTODY.  ADA David Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:08 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states the appearances.

Amended Information had been filed with the State adding 3 additional charges but has since been withdrawn by the State.
Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed. (per Atty Raabe has been changed so many time not sure if should turn in - Court inform's to provide and is done so).
Prosecutor states plea agreement on the record.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - No contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorney stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).
Atty Knaapen makes statements that the defendant had provided to law enforcement a written statement - this had not been provided at the time of the criminal complaint.
Atty Raabe makes statements on the record.

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty of Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. 

Atty Raabe would like to be heard regarding the request for the PSI and makes statements, these previous charges are dated and occurred approx., 7 years ago.
If PSI were to be requested then defendant would remain in jail until time of sentencing.
Atty Raabe states that if PSI ordered that a change in the bond be completed and be released on a significantly lower cash bond and not be held in jail so that he may be able to go back to work. 
Defense attorney and his client would like to proceed without the PSI.

Parties are ready to proceed to sentencing.
Prosecutor argues regarding sentencing recommendations.
Attorney for Defendant argues regarding sentencing recommendations.
Court asks the Defendant if he/she wants to make any statements.
Defendant does not wish to make any statements on his behalf.
Victim notification had been completed and the victim's do not appear in the courtroom to make a statement.
Atty Knaapen does state that the victim's did indicate that they did not feel that enough jail time had been invoked for the defendant.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 -
Sentence withheld
Probation for 3 years
Jail credit of 109 days 
150 days in county jail with Huber privileges are granted pursuant to Sec. 303.08(1) Stats. and subject to the rules of the Portage County Sheriff's Department.
Obtain and maintain full-time employment.
Provide DNA sample unless already provided 
AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.
Cooperate with any other assessments requested by the department.
Participate in any counseling recommended by the agent.
Pay Court costs which includes the DNA Surcharge  
Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Daniel Sanchez, Steven Solis, their families or their residences and Iverson Park and no contact with co-defendants.
Perform 80 hours of commuity service during term of probation.
Pay $65.32 joint/several with co-defendants (cost of obtaining medical records).
Pay restitution joint/several with co-defendants.  State to have additional 60 days to submit figures and then provide copy to the defendant and his attorney.
20 days to seek post conviction relief.
Motion hearing on September 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Frank Martinez in court with attorney Adam Raabe. Defendant Frank Martinez in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
11:32 a.m. case is called and appearances stated on the record.  This is a joint motion hearing.
This a motion hearing and potential motions.  
This is a motion for joinder.  Attorney McFarland has received and Attorney Raabe has received the motion as well.
Attorney McFarland states there is an objection to joinder but Attorney Raabe states there is no objection.
ADA Knaapen states the states position on the record.
Attorney McFarland states its objection on the record.  Defendant was the only person with driver's license.
Court questions the 5th amendment right at sentencing.  
Attorney Knaapen responds to the defense' statement.   
Court questions - Neither defendant made a statement to the police.    Attorney McFarland makes a response to the court.
Court states its findings on the record.  
BTC:
The court grants the states motion for joinder.  Both matter will be tried starting 10-1-2014.

Motion to exclude evidence
ADA Knaapen states that discovery has been sent to both defense counsel.  
Attorney Raabe states he has received the discovery.  He would like extension to file motions.  
Court questions the reason for length of time that discovery was sent out.  ADA Knaapen responds to the same.  

Court denies the motion to exclude.  However the court will point out that discovery needs to be provided in a timely manner and it has a duty to supplement any discovery immediately.

Motions due by September 17, 2014

11:51 a.m. court is in recess.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 23, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Motion to Exclude Evidence Not Presented for Inspection or Copying
Pre-trial conference on September 8, 2014 at 10:30 am.

Defendant Frank Martinez in court with attorney Adam Raabe. Defendant Frank Martinez in custody. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 8, 2014 at 10:30 am.
Motion hearing on September 2, 2014 at 11:30 am.
Jury trial on October 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Atty Raabe makes statements to the Court in regards to the motion to Dismiss the Use of a Dangerous Weapon Penalty Enhancer.
Atty Knaapen makes arguments in opposition to the motion.
Court questions parties. 

BY THE COURT: Motion is denied for the reasons stated on the record.

14CF230: Defendant Frank Martinez in court with attorney Adam Raabe. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
14CF231: Erik Mcfarland appears in court.  Defendant Auston Ortiz does not appear. 

Court indicates the following matters are heard together for a STATUS CONFERENCE: 14CF230 Frank Martinez and 14CF231 Auston Ortiz.

Court reviews the files.  Has not received a motion for joinder for these files. 
Court sets the Martinez file (14CF230) for a 2 day Jury Trial on 10-01-14 beginning at 8:30 a.m. to honor the speedy trial demand.
Ortiz (14CF231) will also be set for jury trial that day.  If there is no joinder, then Ortiz (14CF231) will be set in the number 2 position. 
Atty Knaapen indicates he can have the joinder motion filed by the end of this week and asks to set a motion date for that. 

Both files: 
Motion to Join is set for September 2, 2014 at 11:30 a.m.    
Any pre-trial motions and proposed jury instructions should be filed by August 22, 2014 on both matters. 

Atty Raabe indicates he has not received discovery as of yet. 
Atty Knaapen will provide the information they have but are waiting on crime lab results and such. 


  Jury trial scheduled for October 1, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Motion hearing scheduled for September 2, 2014 at 11:30 am.
Application for Search Warrant, Search Warrant and Return of Officer
Status conference on August 5, 2014 at 01:30 pm.
to Dismiss the Use of a Dangerous Weapon Penalty Enhancer
Plea hearing on August 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Frank Martinez in court with attorney Adam Raabe. Defendant Frank Martinez in custody. David R Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

9:48 am. Court calls case.
Atty Knaapen states appearances.
This is a Motion to modify bond.
Court questions if a Motion has been filed.
Atty Raabe indicates he faxed a Motion on 7-2-14 to the Br 1 office.
Court reviews Motion provided by Atty Raabe.
Atty Raabe makes arguments in regards to Motion.
Atty Raabe indicates his client can post $500 to be released.
Atty Knaapen makes arguments.
Atty Knaapen asks that the bond remains as it stands.
Court makes statements.

BTC:
Bond Continued. Conditions continued. Motion is denied.

Arraignment:
State has filed Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 
Defendant pleas Not Guilty entered.

BTC:
Not Guilty plea entered.  Plea hearing scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
by FAX
Arraignment on August 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Court calls cases at 3:18 p.m. Defendants are all in custody.  ADA Knaapan calls for all cases to be heard together.
Co-Defendant cases called together for Preliminary Hearing today: 14CF229 Angelo Garcia w/Atty Lloyd, 14CF230 Frank Martinez w/Atty Raabe, 14CF231 Auston Ortiz w/Atty McFarland, 14CF232 Jesus Rangel w/Atty Arendt.
3:19 p.m. ADA Knaapen calls witness, Kent Lepak, who is sworn in and testifies during direct exam.  Witness identified Defendant Garcia, Defendant Rangel, Defendant Martinez, and Defendant Ortiz as sitting by their respective attorneys.
3:33 p.m. Atty Arendt (Defendant Rangel) cross exam of witness.
3:37 p.m. Atty Lloyd (Defendant Garcia) cross exam of witness.
3:39 p.m. Atty McFarland (Defendant Ortiz) cross exam of witness.
3:42 p.m. Atty Raabe (Defendant Martinez) cross exam of witness.
3:43 p.m. ADA Knaapen redirect.
3:44 p.m. No further testimony.  Witness steps down.
Each attorney will be heard in regards to their respective Defendant.
3:45 p.m. Atty Arendt makes argument that his client is not involved.
3:46 p.m. ADA Knaapen states Defendant Rangel was a party to the crime.  
3:47 p.m. Atty Lloyd no statements.
3:47 p.m. ADA Knaapen  Defendant Garcia did the action of striking.
3:49 p.m. Atty McFarland makes argument that there is not probable cause for Defendant Ortiz and request dismissal.
3:50 p.m. ADA Knaapen states Defendant Ortiz was a party to the crime - get-away car.
3:51 p.m. Atty Raabe makes argument and request dismissal for Defendant Martinez.
3:54 p.m. ADA Knaapen states Defendant was active in striking/hitting and party to the crime.

BTC:   
14CF229 Angelo Garcia 14CF229 Br 1 case: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial.

14CF231 Auston Ortiz Br 1:   Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial. 

14CF230 Frank Martinez Br 1: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial. 

14CF232 Jesus Rangel Br 1: Court finds it is probable that a felony was committed and this defendant committed it and binds the defendant over for trial. 

All case to be schedule for Arraignment 08-18-14 at 8:30 am. for 14CF229, 14CF232, 14CF230.  Arraignment for 14CF231 (Ortiz-Atty McFArland) set for 08-18-14 at 11:30 a.m.

Bond on all cases continued.  Arraignment scheduled for August 18, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Atty Raabe
Preliminary hearing on June 30, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

Attorney Adam Raabe in court. David R Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant Frank Martinez appeared by video. Prosecuting Atty David R Knaapen appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Defendant/Attorney received copy of Criminal Complaint and waived its reading.
Court informs Defendant of Charges and maximum penalties.
Not willing to waive time limits.
Bond continued.
Atty Raabe request a reduced bond to $500 cash bond.
ADA Knaapen informs the that the current bond is reasonable.
BTC:  Motion to modify bond is denied.
Bond remains the same and is continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 30, 2014 at 03:00 pm.

No contact with Daniel Sanchez or Steven Solis or their residences, direct/indirect, whether in custody or release.
  Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.

ADA David Knaapen appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Knaapen states facts for anticipated charges of Substantial Batter-Intend Bodily Harm, Disorderly Conduct.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
State requests a $15,000 cash bond with conditions as stated. 

Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court advises defendant of right to make a statement/remain silent. 
Defendant indicates he is employed at Golden Corral. 

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  6/16/14  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 2
